newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk minister sees lira drop near inflation rate.
newsitem.headline: Turk minister sees lira drop near inflation rate.

text.p: Turkey's State Minister Ufuk Soylemez said the depreciation rate of the lira against major currencies would be around the inflation rate, Anatolian news agency said on Wednesday.

"It is predicted that depreciation of the Turkish lira will be around inflation rate," Soylemez, in charge of the treasury and privatisation, was quoted by the agency as replying to a question from an opposition MP.
Turkey has been keeping lira depreciation near the inflation rate since end-1994 as part of its drive toward what is called a realistic exchange rate policy.
"We will implement a realistic exchange rate policy to increase our competitive strength," Soylemez said.

The lira depreciated last year by 60 percent against the central bank's currency basket consisting of one dollar and 1.5 marks. That was down from a wholesale price inflation of about 65 percent in the same period.
